previous.name: The Finest Lady in the Land

segments.en: Linked Discourses 47
3. Ethics and Duration
21. Ethics
So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca ānando āyasmā ca bhaddo pāṭaliputte viharanti kukkuṭārāme.
segments.en: At one time the venerables Ānanda and Bhadda were staying at Pāṭaliputta, in the Chicken Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā bhaddo sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Bhadda came out of retreat, went to Venerable Ānanda, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā bhaddo āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Ānanda:

segments.pli: “yānimāni, āvuso ānanda, kusalāni sīlāni vuttāni bhagavatā, imāni kusalāni sīlāni kimatthiyāni vuttāni bhagavatā”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend Ānanda, the Buddha has spoken of skillful ethics. What’s their purpose?”
“Good, good, Reverend Bhadda!

segments.pli: Bhaddako kho te, āvuso bhadda, ummaṅgo, bhaddakaṃ paṭibhānaṃ, kalyāṇī paripucchā.
segments.en: Your approach and articulation are excellent, and it’s a good question.
For you asked:

segments.pli: ‘yānimāni, āvuso ānanda, kusalāni sīlāni vuttāni bhagavatā, imāni kusalāni sīlāni kimatthiyāni vuttāni bhagavatā’”ti?
segments.en: ‘The Buddha has spoken of skillful ethics. What’s their purpose?’”
“Yes, reverend.”

segments.pli: “Yānimāni, āvuso bhadda, kusalāni sīlāni vuttāni bhagavatā, imāni kusalāni sīlāni yāvadeva catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvanāya vuttāni bhagavatā.
segments.en: “The Buddha has spoken of skillful ethics to the extent necessary for developing the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
What four?

segments.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
mind …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Yānimāni, āvuso bhadda, kusalāni sīlāni vuttāni bhagavatā, imāni kusalāni sīlāni yāvadeva imesaṃ catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvanāya vuttāni bhagavatā”ti.
segments.en: The Buddha has spoken of skillful ethics to the extent necessary for developing the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”

suttaplex.blurb: Venerable Bhadda asks Ānanda about the ethical virtues encouraged by the Buddha—what is their purpose? To develop the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
